Text:
It is night, and a lone figure stands on the training
ground, swinging her sword intentlyâ€”Number 666.

(I should be exhausted, but I'm much too anxious to
sleep...)

(The only thing that can calm me in this state is
pushing myself past my limits.)

(I'll swing my sword just a little more and become
that tiny bit stronger. There is so much I still lack,
but even the smallest effort ought to make some
positive change.)
Ha! Yaah!

I thought someone was making an awful racket and look
who I find...Number 666.
Instructor Lambda?! My apologies, I'll leave at once!

Before you do, let me ask you something. Where did
you learn those sword techniques?
Hah!

I'm mimicking a style of swordplay that I admire.
Drawing upon a childhood memory that was
burned into my mind.
A style of swordplay you admire, huh... I see.

(A style that combines both power and grace...much
like that of Master Shadow and Lady Alpha.)

(I don't know why someone like her, who only just
joined the Garden, would be familiar with their
techniques...)

(Still, this is a far cry from their brilliance.
Even for simple imitation, it's much too
crude.)
Um... Am I doing something wrong?

...No, it's nothing. I've changed my mind. I'm going
to offer you a test.
Y-Yes, ma'am! Thank you so much!
Now...cut that boulder over there.
Lambda points to a large boulder.
Cut it...? Is that all?

Anyone could cut the boulders around here if they
infuse a little magic into their sword...
Spare me. Just show me you can do it.
Understood. Now then...haaa!!!

Number 666 fills her sword with magic and swings it at
the boulder, causing it to break part with a clatter.
...Phew. Instructor Lambda, as you asked, Iâ€”

As I asked? Do you not even know the difference
between "cut" and "shatter"?
Wh-What do you mean...?

Allow me to demonstrate. This is what I mean
by "cut"!

Lambda unleashes a magic-infused strike toward one of
the boulders, cleanly bisecting it without breaking
apart. The stone had quite literally been cut.
A-Amazing... You sliced it so cleanly...!

I wouldn't be so happy. Because I expect you to do
this too.

You've got one week. Make sure you can cut a boulder
by then.

But I want you back here for practice tomorrow.
Think of rest as another skill to master.
Yes, ma'am! Thank you!

(This is not some unreasonable task... No, I've been
given a chance.)

(I've been blundering along, unsure of what to do,
but this could very well show me the way forward.)
(...I'll prove I can do it, no matter what!)
